What I enjoy about Portal 2 is that it is a first-person puzzle game. You have to think through what you are going to do instead of run in guns blazing. The game physics make it challenging. You can still destroy things but you have to be smart about it.

Rated #1 game on steam for the longest time for a reason. Crazy how a game doesn't have to have AAA graphics or a crazy budget to be amazing. With the release of stuff like Cyberpunk and the PS5, its nice to just think about the simpler days of gaming. Where games consisted of a few developers working on something with passion, with no expectation of international success. You can just see how much effort they put into it, from all the bad jokes/references to the visuals to the music- everything is made with detail and love. Kinda cool how Steam is run by valve, and also how the top game on their own platform is by them as well. 

A classic game and one that has set the tone for the gold standard since its release- anyone who hasn't played this is missing out!
